lexUnit.name: shard.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sharp piece of broken ceramic, metal, glass, etc.

sentence.text: Not that the ball needed an extra medal for , to Lucille , it seemed as though a jewel shop had been exploded into extravagant shards of light and colour .
Bent double , nipping to the car boot to get the drug bag , I see the car 's rear window has been bashed in ; broken glass shards cover the rear seat .
Helen screamed and fell back from the window just as it exploded over her , showering heavy glass shards across the dining room table .
Should England win the World Cup next time round , you will undoubtedly notice that a small shard of plexiglass is missing from the said carrying case .
As they moved cautiously towards it , Fenella saw that it had opened for them just the smallest sliver and that beyond it were shards of light .
She bent to pick up broken shards of china , gritting her teeth as her head protested .
Shards of glass were still falling 12 hours after the blast and computers had been blown on to the pavement .
He rolled through the space , snapping a shard of glass that sliced his jacket and put a nick in his shoulder .
Casey stood above him , a wicked-looking shard of glass in her hand .
Everywhere you look , little shards of glass glistening in the lamplight .
Minute shards of glass slashed across Rohmer 's ecstatic face .
Her finger snagged on roughened bark , and she stared down at it , watching the bright droplets of blood trickle to the floor and settle among shards of broken glass .
His blue eyes held shards of ice as he glared down at her , his features darkening in annoyance .
Sherds of such pottery have been found on sites along the eastern seaboard of the United States , including Florida , the Caribbean islands and parts of South America such as Venezuela .
Over a hundred sherds of pottery were recovered from the rampart .
A bone needle , some animal bones and a few sherds of pottery were found here .
She started to scrape again with the shard of pottery .
